butternut-squash-lasagna.description: Nutty, roasted butternut squash paired with the cheesy goodness of mozzarella, ricotta and parmesan makes this vegetarian dish a beautiful summer meal that is simultaneously light, rich and flavorful. Fresh sage, nutmeg and smoked paprika infuse plenty of flavor into a plate that is gluten free and packed with nutritious vegetables.
directions: Roast uncut butternut squash for 1 hour at 400 °F, once they are roasted cut them in half, remove the seeds and skin. Mash them with 1/2 cup of almond milk, 2 Tbls of butter, 1 Tbls of nutmeg, 1/4 cup of fresh sage, 1 tsp of salt, and 1 tsp of pepper.

Saute' the spinach with 1 tsp of olive oil, 1 tsp of salt, and 1 tsp of pepper. Remove the spinach from the pan, place in a bowl and add 1 cup of ricotta cheese and 1 egg; mix together with smoked paparika, nutmeg, salt and pepper.
Take 6 medium zucchini, wash them, cut off the ends and slice thinly lengthwise; place those under a broiler and lightly broil them both size.
Layer in an 8x10 casserole pan. First the butternut squash, then the sliced zucchini, then the sliced mozzarella, and finally the spinach with ricotta. Repeat that layering one more time.
Sprinkle grated parmesan and nutmeg liberally over the top. Place it in the oven and bake it to 350 °F for 35 to 40 minutes.
butternut-squash-lasagna.name: Butternut Squash Lasagna

directions: 8 medium tomatillos remove hasks wash and quarter
place in a glass backing dish add 1/2 yellow onion chopped 1 lime quartered including rind
cilantro 1/4 cup chopped fresh 1 medium alapenjo
drizzle w/ olive oil and place in a 400 oF oven for 40 minutes
remove from pan and place into a blender except the lime
blend rosted vegetables and poor into a mixing bowl
when it's blended you add 1/4 cup of finely chopped fresh cilantro, squeeze the juice from the lime into the mixture and then add a table spoon of cumin, salt and pepper to taste
tomatillo-salsa-verde.name: Tomatillo Salsa Verde
